description: A micro-lesson that makes The Mozart Effect: Does Classical Music Make You Smarter? usable.

hook.text: In 1993, a study claimed listening to Mozart for 10 minutes boosted IQ. Georgia's governor gave every newborn a Mozart

discovery.text: Follow-up studies showed any stimulating music works equally well. The effect was arousal, not Mozart. Upbeat rock

twist.text: A billion-dollar industry of 'brain-boosting' baby products was built on a misunderstood 15-minute effect. Marketing

climax.text: The Mozart Effect shows how easily small findings become big myths when media, hope, and commerce combine.
